title: Bangladesh Press Council
text:
Bangladesh Press Council is an quasi-judicial institution that protects freedom of speech and regulates the press in Bangladesh and is located in <a href="Dhaka">Dhaka</a>, <a href="Bangladesh">Bangladesh</a>.
History.
The act to establish the institution was passed in 1974. The institution was established on 18 August 1979. In 2016 the <a href="Bangladesh%20Law%20Commission">Bangladesh Law commission</a> recommended that the council be given the power to close any newspaper temporarily.
